repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p: This manuscript contains a poem on the life of the Indian convert and Saint Tēvacakāyam Piḷḷai (1712-1752), also known under his Christian name of Lazarus. The poem belongs to one of the ciṟṟilakkiyam genres, the maṇimālai.

filiation.p: This text exists in multiple manuscripts in India, and it has just recently been published for the first time (see the bibliography below).

extent.measure: 1 + 87 + 1 (U1a + U1b + U1c). 1 front guard folio, 87 numbered folios, 1 back guard folio.

supportDesc.foliation: Tamil letter numerals on the left margin. Arabic numbers added recently in pencil on the right margin.

collation.desc: the front cover. On the front board we find the BnF shelfmark sticker.

The manuscript is constituted by one unit single unit containing the text. The front guard folio was certainly added before 1845, since it contains on the left margin a shelfmark n° 4 in black ink. Indeed, this manuscript is no. 4 in the catalogue by Veḷāṅkaṇṇi Arōkkiyam written in 1845, now NAF 5443 (see f2v). There are two guard folios at the end, one with a date and one with an engraved picture.

layoutDesc.layout: F1r contains several paratexts organized in three columns, but this is the only occurrence of such folio arrangement in the manuscript (which is otherwise in the scriptio continua occupying the whole leaf). f87r contains a scribal colophon on the left margin, and is otherwise empty.

handNote.desc: Long ē and ō are not systematically marked. The text seems to have been written by two different hands (in connection with the variation of the number of lines per folio). Mostly inked (until f. 76r).

decoNote.desc: The back guard folio contains drawings of animals. On the recto, we find two central animal figures which seem complete. The one on the left has cat-like pointy years and next to it we find a legend saying (ciṅkam); on its right is another figure, most likely an armadillo. On the extreme right, the scribe begun sketching a third figure which only has a body and a tail, and is therefore not recognizable. On the left margin of the verso of the back guard folio is another figure, likely unfinished, but similar to the armadillo on the recto.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 487 (front cover). The sticker is upside down compared to the direction in which the manuscript is to be read.
Label/caption/legend above the drawing of a lion: ciṅkam (f[1]r).

binding.p: The manuscript is bound with front and back pinewood boards.

acquisition.p: The manuscript originally belonged to Edouard Ariel, who donated it to the BnF.
